## Studio Resource Properties {#properties}

To learn more about resource properties and how to use them, see [Inputs and Outputs]({{< relref "/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs" >}}) in the Architecture and Concepts docs.

### Inputs

The Studio resource accepts the following [input]({{< relref "/docs/intro/concepts/inputs-outputs" >}}) properties:



{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="authmode_csharp">
<a href="#authmode_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Auth<wbr>Mode</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#studioauthmode">Pulumi.<wbr>Aws<wbr>Native.<wbr>EMR.<wbr>Studio<wbr>Auth<wbr>Mode</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using single sign-on (SSO) or IAM. Amazon EMR Studio currently only supports SSO authentication.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="defaults3location_csharp">
<a href="#defaults3location_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Default<wbr>S3Location</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The default Amazon S3 location to back up EMR Studio Workspaces and notebook files. A Studio user can select an alternative Amazon S3 location when creating a Workspace.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="enginesecuritygroupid_csharp">
<a href="#enginesecuritygroupid_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Engine<wbr>Security<wbr>Group<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio Engine security group. The Engine security group allows inbound network traffic from the Workspace security group, and it must be in the same VPC specified by VpcId.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="servicerole_csharp">
<a href="#servicerole_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Service<wbr>Role</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The IAM role that will be assumed by the Amazon EMR Studio. The service role provides a way for Amazon EMR Studio to interoperate with other AWS services.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="subnetids_csharp">
<a href="#subnetids_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Subnet<wbr>Ids</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A list of up to 5 subnet IDs to associate with the Studio. The subnets must belong to the VPC specified by VpcId. Studio users can create a Workspace in any of the specified subnets.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="vpcid_csharp">
<a href="#vpcid_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Vpc<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The ID of the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) to associate with the Studio.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="workspacesecuritygroupid_csharp">
<a href="#workspacesecuritygroupid_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Workspace<wbr>Security<wbr>Group<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio Workspace security group. The Workspace security group allows outbound network traffic to resources in the Engine security group, and it must be in the same VPC specified by VpcId.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="description_csharp">
<a href="#description_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Description</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A detailed description of the Studio.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="idpauthurl_csharp">
<a href="#idpauthurl_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Idp<wbr>Auth<wbr>Url</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Your identity provider's authentication endpoint. Amazon EMR Studio redirects federated users to this endpoint for authentication when logging in to a Studio with the Studio URL.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="idprelaystateparametername_csharp">
<a href="#idprelaystateparametername_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Idp<wbr>Relay<wbr>State<wbr>Parameter<wbr>Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The name of relay state parameter for external Identity Provider.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="name_csharp">
<a href="#name_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A descriptive name for the Amazon EMR Studio.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="tags_csharp">
<a href="#tags_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Tags</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#studiotag">List&lt;Pulumi.<wbr>Aws<wbr>Native.<wbr>EMR.<wbr>Inputs.<wbr>Studio<wbr>Tag<wbr>Args&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A list of tags to associate with the Studio. Tags are user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string with a maximum of 128 characters, and an optional value string with a maximum of 256 characters.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="userrole_csharp">
<a href="#userrole_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">User<wbr>Role</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The IAM user role that will be assumed by users and groups logged in to a Studio. The permissions attached to this IAM role can be scoped down for each user or group using session policies.{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

            title="Required">
        <span id="servicerole_nodejs">
<a href="#servicerole_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">service<wbr>Role</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The IAM role that will be assumed by the Amazon EMR Studio. The service role provides a way for Amazon EMR Studio to interoperate with other AWS services.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="subnetids_nodejs">
<a href="#subnetids_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">subnet<wbr>Ids</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string[]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A list of up to 5 subnet IDs to associate with the Studio. The subnets must belong to the VPC specified by VpcId. Studio users can create a Workspace in any of the specified subnets.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="vpcid_nodejs">
<a href="#vpcid_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">vpc<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The ID of the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) to associate with the Studio.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="workspacesecuritygroupid_nodejs">
<a href="#workspacesecuritygroupid_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">workspace<wbr>Security<wbr>Group<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The ID of the Amazon EMR Studio Workspace security group. The Workspace security group allows outbound network traffic to resources in the Engine security group, and it must be in the same VPC specified by VpcId.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="description_nodejs">
<a href="#description_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">description</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A detailed description of the Studio.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="idpauthurl_nodejs">
<a href="#idpauthurl_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">idp<wbr>Auth<wbr>Url</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Your identity provider's authentication endpoint. Amazon EMR Studio redirects federated users to this endpoint for authentication when logging in to a Studio with the Studio URL.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="idprelaystateparametername_nodejs">
<a href="#idprelaystateparametername_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">idp<wbr>Relay<wbr>State<wbr>Parameter<wbr>Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The name of relay state parameter for external Identity Provider.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="name_nodejs">
<a href="#name_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A descriptive name for the Amazon EMR Studio.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="tags_nodejs">
<a href="#tags_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">tags</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#studiotag">Studio<wbr>Tag<wbr>Args[]</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}A list of tags to associate with the Studio. Tags are user-defined key-value pairs that consist of a required key string with a maximum of 128 characters, and an optional value string with a maximum of 256 characters.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="userrole_nodejs">
<a href="#userrole_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">user<wbr>Role</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The IAM user role that will be assumed by users and groups logged in to a Studio. The permissions attached to this IAM role can be scoped down for each user or group using session policies.{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language python %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="auth_mode_python">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#studioauthmode">Studio<wbr>Auth<wbr>Mode</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Specifies whether the Studio authenticates users using single sign-on (SSO) or IAM. Amazon EMR Studio currently only supports SSO authentication.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">

        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>

            title="Required">
        <span id="engine_security_group_id_python">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>

            title="Required">
        <span id="service_role_python">

## Supporting Types



<h4 id="studioauthmode">Studio<wbr>Auth<wbr>Mode</h4>

{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="tabular"><dt>Sso</dt>
    <dd>SSO</dd><dt>Iam</dt>
    <dd>IAM</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language go %}}
<dl class="tabular"><dt>Studio<wbr>Auth<wbr>Mode<wbr>Sso</dt>
    <dd>SSO</dd><dt>Studio<wbr>Auth<wbr>Mode<wbr>Iam</dt>
    <dd>IAM</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language nodejs %}}
<dl class="tabular"><dt>Sso</dt>
    <dd>SSO</dd><dt>Iam</dt>
    <dd>IAM</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language python %}}
<dl class="tabular"><dt>SSO</dt>
    <dd>SSO</dd><dt>IAM</dt>
    <dd>IAM</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

<h4 id="studiotag">Studio<wbr>Tag</h4>

{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="key_csharp">
<a href="#key_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Key</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 127 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -. {{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="value_csharp">
<a href="#value_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 255 Unicode characters in length. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -. {{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language go %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">

<a href="#key_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Key</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 127 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -. {{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="value_go">
<a href="#value_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 255 Unicode characters in length. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -. {{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}
